BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: MILL NECK MANOR SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: MILL NECK MANOR SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF OPERATES TWO SPECIAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS SERVING NEARLY 200 CHILDREN FROM THE NEW YORK CITY and LONG ISLAND AREA WHO ARE DEAF OR WHOSE HEARING OR SPEECH IS OTHERWISE IMPAIRED.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MILL NECK MANOR SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF EXISTS TO PROVIDE THE HIGHEST QUALITY OF EDUCATIONAL SERVICES TO DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING CHILDREN, ASSIST CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS, AND PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THEIR FAMILIES IN AN ATMOSPHERE OF GENUINE CARING AND NURTURING.
IRS990.Desc: DEAF EDUCATION PROGRAM - OPERATING UNDER SECTION 4201 OF THE NY STATE EDUCATION LAW, MILL NECK MANOR SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF SERVES over 120 PROFOUNDLY DEAF CHILDREN. CHILDREN BEGIN RECEIVING SERVICES AS SOON AS DEAFNESS IS DIAGNOSED, OFTEN BEFORE AGE ONE. BY THREE YEARS OLD, CHILDREN ATTEND THE PROGRAM FULL-TIME. BENEFITING BY A TOTAL COMMUNICATION PHILOSOPHY, CHILDREN ARE ABLE TO COMMUNICATE USING SPEECH, SIGN LANGUAGE AND OTHER COMMUNICATION FORMS. THE SCHOOL OFFERS A FULL RANGE OF OPPORTUNITIES, INCLUDING AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS, SPORTS TEAMS AND DRIVER EDUCATION. THE SCHOOL IS LICENSED TO AWARD A NYS HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA.DEAF INFANT PROGRAM - OPERATING UNDER SECTION 4204A OF THE NY STATE EDUCATION LAW, MILL NECK MANOR SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF PROVIDES INTENSE SUPPORT TO FAMILIES WHO LEARN THAT THEIR BABIES ARE DEAF OR HEARING IMPAIRED. AS EARLY AS EIGHT MONTHS OF AGE, CHILDREN ACCOMPANIED BY THEIR PARENTS COME TO CAMPUS TWO TIMES A WEEK, THE PURPOSE IS TO CREATE COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE CHILD AND THE PARENT. THE SCHOOL ALSO VISITS THE FAMILY HOME EACH WEEK TO SUGGEST WAYS TO IMPROVE COMMUNICATION. AT AGE THREE, MOST CHILDREN WILL ENTER THE MILL NECK MANOR PRESCHOOL PROGRAM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAMS - Dormitory Authority (DA) 9250 - Expenses relating to projects funded or anticipated to be funded through bonds issued through the New York State Dormitory Authority. Bonds are issued to finance the construction, renovation and equipping of various projects for certain not-for-profit institutions authorized by statute. This program is composed of revenues and expenses associated with Dormitory Authority Projects that are funded or anticipated to be funded with DA bond proceeds. In the case of Mill Neck Manor School for the Deaf, this program represents the depreciation costs of the school building which was built utilizing Dormitory Authority funds.CFR-2 programsExtended day services Mill Neck offers extended day services for students outside of the typical school day. Supervised early drop off and aftercare are available to students at an additional tuition fee.Coaching and sports Offered outside of the regular curriculum, after school and/or off-campus, students are able to participate in sports activities and events, sometimes traveling for sports competitions with other schoolsCampus-wide Mill Neck Manor owns several buildings on the 86-acre lot. These buildings are the responsibility of the entity, whether or not they are occupied. Upkeep and maintenance of these buildings is required and have their own costs, outside of the regular school programs.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SPECIAL EDUCATION PRESCHOOL - OPERATING UNDER SECTION 4410 OF THE NY STATE EDUCATION LAW, MILL NECK MANOR SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF OPERATES A PRESCHOOL PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN AGES 3 & 4 WHO HAVE BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH A SPEECH AND/OR LANGUAGE DISABILITY. USING SMALL CLASS RATIOS (UP TO 12 CHILDREN WITH 3 ADULTS supervising), THE LATEST TECHNIQUES ARE UTILIZED TO ENCOURAGE AND PRODUCE IMPROVED SPEECH AND LANGUAGE. CHILDREN RECEIVE INDIVIDUAL AND GROUP THERAPY ALONG WITH OCCUPATIONAL OR PHYSICAL THERAPIES AS NEEDED. AT AGE 5 CHILDREN RETURN TO THEIR HOME DISTRICT, MOST OFTEN NOT NEEDING FURTHER SPECIAL EDUCATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: he School is an exempt organization under Section 501(a) of the Internal Revenue Code as an organization described in Section 501 (c)(3). The School has adopted the provisions of FASB ASC 740, Income Taxes, which requires that a tax position be recognized or derecognized based on a more likely than not threshold. This applies to positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. The School does not believe its financial statements include any uncertain tax positions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE RACIALLY NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY OF MILL NECK SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF IS PUBLISHED IN THE SCHOOL'S PUBLICATION "MILESTONES".

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Part I, Line 1a: Relevant information in regards to selections on 1a.
Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: IDEA 611 AND 619 GRANTS - district(s) of residence forward federal grant funds to Mill Neck Manor which enables its programs to meet the unique, specialized needs of the deaf and communication-impaired students by providing a specially trained reading teacher to enhance literacy, a sign language interpreter to ensure students have full access to communication, and a Spanish language interpreter that enables Spanish-speaking families to have full engagement in the education process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND AUDIT COMMITTEE RECEIVE A DRAFT OF THE COMPLETED 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED. MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE AND AUDIT COMMITTEES ARE DULY AUTHORITIZED BY THE BOARD TO REVIEW THE 990 AND HAVE 14 DAYS TO REVIEW AND RESPOND TO THE VICE CHAIRMAN AND ASSISTANT CONTROLLER WITH COMMENTS, QUESTIONS OR SUGGESTED REVISIONS. THE VICE CHAIRMAN AND ASSISTANT CONTROLLER, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE CHAIRMAN AND/OR CPA FIRM MAY ACCEPT OR REJECT THE PROPOSED REVISIONS. THE FINAL 990 IS SENT TO THE IRS AND MADE AVAILABLE TO THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO BOARD MEMBER, KEY EMPLOYEE NOR FAMILY MEMBERS MAY HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP WITH THE ORGANIZATION. ALL SUCH PERSONS ATTEST TO THIS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY SIGNING A WRITTEN DOCUMENT. ALL SUCH PERSONS ARE WELL KNOWN TO THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE IRS FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE BY WRITING TO: MILL NECK SCHOOL FOR THE DEAF, ATTN: Lindsey Johansen, 40 FROST MILL ROAD, MILL NECK, NY 11765.
